H0.text: The lahara, used in the liqueur Curacao, is an adaptation of which common fruit. Lemon

H1.text: The lahara, used in the liqueur Curacao, is an adaptation of which common fruit. Grapefruit

H2.text: The lahara, used in the liqueur Curacao, is an adaptation of which common fruit. Pineapple

H3.text: The lahara, used in the liqueur Curacao, is an adaptation of which common fruit. Orange

A4.text: Spanish explorers had brought the progenitor of the laraha, the bitter Seville orange, to the island in 1527.

A5.text: Curaçao liqueur is traditionally made with the dried peels of the laraha (Citrus × aurantium subsp. currassuviencis), a bitter orange that had selectively adapted to conditions on Curaçao island.
